channel.title: 562 loading 602 Auto Cache Download
channel.description:
Now Some of you are experiencing problems with the auto cache downloader for 562 loading 602 client/webclient. In this turtorial Il show you how to make the cache actually auto download and work!! Okay so lets Start Difficulty 2/10 for begginers If you got a 562 loading 602 client. Go to qs.java Search For
private static boolean checkRevision()
And under it you should see a directory, Yours maybe something like this
C:/.562_cache_32v4/cacheRevision.txt
Change that to this
C:/562_cache_32v4/cacheRevision.txt
You may ask, Why the hell is he saying that? theyre the exact same!! Well, think twice, thier not. One is .562_cache and the other is just 562_cache without the '.' Infront of the 5. I changed it to this because if it stayed .562 , It would automatically download part of it. dont ask why... It Just Will Now search for
client.downloadCache
You should see something like this
client.downloadCache("http://Revengescape.com", ".562Cachev4.zip","C:/".562_cache_32v4", "562Cache");
Change
("http://Revengescape.com"
too....
http://download293.mediafire.com/zpbb0mc1buug/zitfdu5riv2acov/.562_cache_32v4.zip
Now where it says
"C:/".562_cache_32v4", "562Cache");
Change it too
C:/"562_cache_32v4", "562Cache"
Again without the '.' before the 5. Now close and save the file, and open the file Class_t.java You will see something like this
Class_x.a("C:/.562_cache_32v4/RevengeScapeCache/");
Change the directory to this
("C:/562_cache_32v4/RevengeScapeCache/");
Now Save and compile and your done!! wohoo! :D. (this only works if your client loads 602/608) If you have errors post below... Also im releasing a webclient tutorial soon! Easy for all of you to understand!! :D.

item.title: 562 loading 602 Auto Cache Download
item.dc:creator: @Generation317or562 Generation317or562
item.description:
@Generation317or562 wrote:

Amazing how Moparscape has went from 317 (possibly before that) to this…

Amazing work, I have faith in the future of RSPSS’

item.title: 562 loading 602 Auto Cache Download
item.dc:creator: @Gazascape Gazascape
item.description:
@Gazascape wrote:

You cant, it wont let you, thats why i made this tut.

You personally cant add ANY folder on your C: Drive begining with a ’ . ’ Itl tell you

“You Must Type In A File Name”

So Thats Why You Need This

Read full topic

item.title: 562 loading 602 Auto Cache Download
item.dc:creator: @Nexus1 Nexus_
item.description:
@Nexus1 wrote:

Or just rename your cache from “562_cache_32v4” to “.562_cache_32v4”…

Read full topic

item.title: 562 loading 602 Auto Cache Download
item.dc:creator: @Gazascape Gazascape
item.description:
@Gazascape wrote:

Now Some of you are experiencing problems with the auto cache downloader for 562 loading 602 client/webclient. In this turtorial Il show you how to make the cache actually auto download and work!! Okay so lets Start

Difficulty 2/10 for begginers

If you got a 562 loading 602 client. Go to qs.java

Search For

private static boolean checkRevision()

And under it you should see a directory, Yours maybe something like this

C:/.562_cache_32v4/cacheRevision.txt

Change that to this

C:/562_cache_32v4/cacheRevision.txt

You may ask, Why the hell is he saying that? theyre the exact same!! Well, think twice, thier not. One is .562_cache and the other is just 562_cache without the ‘.’ Infront of the 5. I changed it to this because if it stayed .562 , It would automatically download part of it. dont ask why… It Just Will

Now search for

client.downloadCache

You should see something like this

client.downloadCache("http://Revengescape.com", ".562Cachev4.zip","C:/".562_cache_32v4", "562Cache");

Change

(“http://Revengescape.com”

too…

http://download293.mediafire.com/zpbb0mc1buug/zitfdu5riv2acov/.562_cache_32v4.zip

Now where it says

"C:/".562_cache_32v4", "562Cache");

Change it too

C:/"562_cache_32v4", "562Cache"
Again without the '.' before the 5.

Now close and save the file, and open the file Class_t.java

You will see something like this

Class_x.a("C:/.562_cache_32v4/RevengeScapeCache/");

Change the directory to this

("C:/562_cache_32v4/RevengeScapeCache/");

Now Save and compile and your done!! wohoo! :D.

(this only works if your client loads 602/608)

If you have errors post below… Also im releasing a webclient tutorial soon! Easy for all of you to understand!! :D.
